title: Design and Utilization of Teacher Education ePortfolios Based on Constructivism and Social Pedagogy

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of Educational Theory and Understanding of Digital Literacy
context.additional_context: Learners are prospective elementary teachers, focusing on reflective learning and collaborative knowledge building using e-portfolios.

learning_goals: Learners can systematically organize and reflect on core concepts of the teacher education curriculum (curriculum design, instructional management, assessment methods) using an e-portfolio.
Learners can integrate knowledge sharing and feedback with peers into their e-portfolios through collaborative activities based on social pedagogical principles.
Learners can design constructivist learning activities, incorporate them into an e-portfolio, and demonstrate learning outcomes through this process.

resources: Online e-Portfolio Platforms (e.g., Mahara, Google Sites)
Online Discussion Tools for Promoting Social Interaction

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
